result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:19 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Gentry E Staggs in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Gentry E Staggs.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Gutierrez provides an update; he has discovery and an offer but needs additional time to review everything.  Atty. Gutierrez requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Assignment of Judge for the defendant returned.  Return to sender, new address provided by USPS.

03:41 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Gentry E Staggs in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he needs time to review discovery and receive an offer.  Atty. Gutierrez requests a further proceedings in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:25 AM Defendant Gentry E Staggs in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
All parties are ready to proceed to preliminary hearing. 
Atty Will calls Officer Garrett Luling who is sworn in and testifies. 
Atty Gutierrez cross examines the witness. 
Atty Will asks a few follow up questions. 
Testimony closed. 
State moves for bind over and states reasons on the record. 
Defense objects to bind over and states reasons on the record. 
   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
State files information. 
Defense accepts filing of the information, waives reading. 
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
